course_title: Jr/Sr Colloquium: Europe: The World of Late Antiquity
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 12 / Seats Avail: 6Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes: This course explores the world of the Roman Empire as it collided with Christianity and then Islam, from the early fourth century to the seventh. This dynamic world of saints, barbarians, empresses, and artists was a period of transition from the classical world to the medieval, but had elements of both. With a focus on material history, students will explore the widely diverse roots of Mediterranean civilization.
course_description: All history majors except those who complete the Honors Program must take two colloquia (HIST 487, 488 or 489). Each colloquium treats a special theme by reading, discussion, and writing of papers. Enrollment in each is limited to twelve; non-majors are welcome within space limitations.
